p: Not only most reported plants are interesting and significant. Scarcely-quoted plants are also important, since in many cases they are representative of particular geographical zones and, in addition, very often they incorporate elements of local identity. This is the case, for instance, of Taraxacum dissectum (Ledeb.) Ledeb. in high mountain regions of the Pyrenees [ 16, 66], of Cytinus hypocistis (L.) L. and Pyrus spinosa Forssk. in arid inner areas of Catalonia [ 18], of Salicornia patula Duval-Jouve in littoral areas (Mar√≠n et al., unpubl. res.) and of Origanum virens Hoffms. et Link and Thymus piperella L. in southern Valencian areas ( Supplementary Material S2).
